content.description: The second bolt is what makes this PG13, it's not too terrible, but if by chance you were to fall just before you clipped the rope (pretty unlikely as there is a decent ledge to stand on, but hey, things happen) you would be very close to hitting the ground. The crux is at the top of the route. When I was originally looking at it, I was thinking it would be rated about 5.7 or so, but after climbing it, I think the top is just a hair under 5.9.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 bolts with quick links at the top.
content.location: Hike from the parking spot up towards the cliffs and to the left. It is to the right of fracture.

content.description: This is a pretty easy climb there are a lot of cracks and many ways to climb it. It is an excellent place to practice trad climbing.
content.protection: I used a number 3 BD cam for the top you may want a .5 to 3 set of cams and some nuts.
content.location: Hike straight up to the cliff, turn left and follow the wall 200 feet to the left. The route is right before a big boulder leaning up against the wall that you can walk under.

content.description: This route starts off with a thin finger crack up until it runs parallel to an identical crack to the left. Then make the pull onto the small shelf with a bush. The next half of the climb is interesting and offwidthy and tricky to protect. Once you reach the top of the unprotected section stand up on ledge and either build an anchor with bomber 4,3 & 2 to bring up your second or continue up to second pitch.
content.protection: standard rack. class 4 walk off to left.
content.location: 30 ft or so left of Aperture. Start in right facing corner under a bush.

content.description: This is a pretty steady climb that I really enjoyed. It isn't hard there isn't a brutal crux it is just fun.
content.protection: There are bolts at the top.
content.location: Hike up from the parking spot to the cliff follow the wall to the left and pass the first two routs. You will notice their are two levels to the cliff continue left 100 ft till you can hike up to the second level. The route should be there.

content.description: This area is not crowded, It gets partial sun. It is located near Cox Canyon Arch.
